metadata.title: CVE-2018-16831 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Smarty before 3.1.33-dev-4 allows attackers to bypass the trusted_dirprotection mechanism via a file:./../ substring in an include statement.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16831` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

smarty3 - 3.1.33+20180830.1.3a78a21f+selfpack1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: smarty3 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.33+20180830.1.3a78a21f+selfpack1-1').
